ANU.name: William Sanders
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
expertise: Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Policy
ANU.biography: Will joined CAEPR as a Research Fellow in 1993 and was appointed as Fellow in 1999 and Senior Fellow in 2007. His undergraduate training was in government, public administration, and political science, and his PhD was on the inclusion of Aboriginal people in the social security system. Will's research interests cover the political and social aspects of Indigenous policy, as well the economic. He regularly works on Indigenous people's participation in elections, on housing and social security policy issues, including the Community Development Employment Projects scheme, and on federal and intergovernmental aspects of Indigenous affairs policy.

ANDS-Grants.description: This project will document the implementation of a major new government program starting in mid 2013 which focuses on employment/participation challenges among Indigenous people in remote areas. It will assess the extent to which the program achieves an approach which is both collaborative with Indigenous communities and integrated across government. It will also develop a conceptual, sociological anlaysis of the role of work in remote Indigenous communities and how this impacts on successive iterations of government policy in this area. The project's significance lies partly in adopting an exploratory approach to program implementation in which it is not assumed that objectives are clear at the outset, except in the most general of terms.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP130100226
